head.supplied: Qualifications ¶ M.R.C.S., F.L.S. Surgeon and General Medical Practitioner. Was Surgeon-Superintendent of the large Bendigo (Sandhurst) Hospital from 1862 to 1873; since then in private practice, chie...

div.p: To the Royal Society of London
List of Candidates 1884, Archives, Royal Society of London.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The lapsed certificate for MacGillivray could not be produced at the Royal Society Archives in November 2019, so the details are taken from the printed List of Candidates prepared annually after 1847 for the information of Council and Fellows (1884 list, p. 9). The layout is modelled on the form of the certificates used in the period.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 9pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.1598in;

note.p: The certificate is dated to 1883 by reference M to W. Thiseleton-Dyer, 10 January 1884 (in this edition as 84-01-10a), which implies that the nomination process was underway and support was being gathered.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Paul Howard MacGillivray
The entries in the tabular part of the text are inferred.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Bendigo,
The former name, Sandhurst, is given in the side-heading in the List of Candidates, and it may have been used by the proposers, but see the descriptive text below. Victoria

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: On the form, 'Qualifications’ is printed vertically to the left of the space for the details.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 9pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.1598in;

note.p: MacGillivray's candidature information was included unchanged in the List of Candidates for 1885, which shows T. S. Cobbold (UK based physician and zoologist) had signed from general knowledge, and for 1886. MacGillivray was not elected.

div.p:
M.R.C.S., F.L.S. Surgeon and General Medical Practitioner. Was Surgeon-Superintendent of the large Bendigo (Sandhurst) Hospital from 1862 to 1873; since then in private practice, chiefly as a Consulting Surgeon. Wrote a "Flora of Aberdeen"
P. MacGillivray (1853). while aiding his father, Prof. MacGillivray. Contributor of descriptions and illustrations of Polyzoa to Prof. MacCoy's 'Prodromus of the Zoology of Victoria', decades iii., iv., v., vi., vii., viii.
McCoy (1878-90); see, for example, P. MacGillivray (1879).
Author of treatises on "Polyzoa" in the Transactions of the Royal Society of Victoria from 1860 to 1883.
For example, P. MacGillivray (1869). Author of essays "On Hydatid Disease," "On Enteric Fever," "On Fractures of Skull," and on various other Medical and Surgical subjects in the Australian Medical Journal.
